channel.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
channel.description:
Just as title says. I am almost done building my system for gaming.
i7 -3770k 800w psu
I am now debating over the following three graphic cards:
-gtx 680(4gb) -gtx 670(4gb) -amd radeion 7970(2-3gb?)
[hr]
I have seen several reviews saying that the 670 outperforms the 680 in certain games for whatever reason. I have also heard that the radeon 78xx-79xx series are amazing.
What are the advantages/disadvantages of each?
Note: I have a processor for amd already in mind if I go with 7979.
Money isn't an issue either so that's not really what I am basing from. I want to play high end video games on my 70 inch television and to do this i have to have a high end rig.

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Loool I’ll sell you my 680, I’d much prefer to have the 670 now, cause I could go SLI and it wouldn’t cost a testicle and a half

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

oh lord they have a better processor than most people would have o.0

It’s a shame neither one of those 590’s/6990 cards are available at newegg :s

so from the impressions I am getting it’s really more against the 670 or the 680. Term wise I guess the 680 would be better.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Loveandpower:

According to that…why does the AMD 6990 outperform a 7xxx series card? o.o

Why wouldn’t it? The 6990 is last generation’s best, why would it not out perform some of this generation’s ‘mediocre offerings’? Just because it has a higher number at the beginning does not mean it is better.

Loveandpower:

and why is the GTX580 so great?

See point above, it was last generation’s equivalent to the 680, it has roughly the same power as the 670.

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:14, topic:518744”]edit: from looking at these scores I would be better off with the 670 considering it’s cheaper than both other cards and has in quite a few games better performance ~^ i will most likely be playing in only 1024 x 800 resolution anyway

edit #2: I guess I should say exactly what my expectations are. I want to play html5 - max settings, wow in max settings, skyrim in max settings, probably mw/bf3 in max settings.
the main goal though is really html5 rs cause that’s what I am trying to achieve to use on my 70 inch for the most part.[/quote]
It’s unlikely to beat the 680, they’re likely anomalies etc, and 1024 x 800?! Are you insane? What’s the point in gaming at that resolution

Either of the cards would have no problem with them.

My recommendation would still be the 670 though, it’s one of the best and very close to the 680 while having a good price/performance ratio, and more (a lot more) than capable of running what you specified, particularly with that ludicrous resolution.

Loveandpower:

I know you said stay away from AMD but why is it in higher resolutions it looks like the AMD starts to perform better from those benchmarks? This is why I was wanting personal fps and not benchmarks on random sites. On those benchmarks it doesn’t state what else was running etc.

If you’re talking about other processes running, then they generally always have the same stuff running on each setup with minimal shit (for lack of a better word) running in the background.
If you’re talking about the hardware setup then it’s all on the second page: http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/geforce-gtx-670-review,3200-3.html

In regards to the AMD performing better at high resolutions, it’s a 3gb card therefore has more memory to cope with the larger textures, unless you’re gaming above anything over 1920x1080 though it’s pointless having more than say 1.5gb or 2gb.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

According to that…why does the AMD 6990 outperform a 7xxx series card? o.o

and why is the GTX580 so great?

@the 800w it was a just a good deal for it. :P. I could had got the 600w for about the same price and was like why not …like $7 more lol

edit: from looking at these scores I would be better off with the 670 considering it’s cheaper than both other cards and has in quite a few games better performance ~^ i will most likely be playing in only 1024 x 800 resolution anyway

edit #2: I guess I should say exactly what my expectations are. I want to play html5 - max settings, wow in max settings, skyrim in max settings, probably mw/bf3 in max settings.
the main goal though is really html5 rs cause that’s what I am trying to achieve to use on my 70 inch for the most part.

I know you said stay away from AMD but why is it in higher resolutions it looks like the AMD starts to perform better from those benchmarks? This is why I was wanting personal fps and not benchmarks on random sites. On those benchmarks it doesn’t state what else was running etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Stu, post:12, topic:518744”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=637008.msg4295050#msg4295050 date=1368064398]

I’ve been looking for cards and most people have recommended GTX 670 due to price and performance.

Go with the 680, I personally have it and it out preforms the 670 on everything.
[/quote]so you would get the 680 out of all of these cards? From your personal experience what type of games with what type of fps are you getting?

I max BF3 and get way over 80 FPS on a monitor 1920x1080.[/quote]
True story that.

I have the 680 too, but I wish I got the 670, the difference in performance is minimal yet quite a difference in price.

Loveandpower:

Any literate computer person knows that a “benchmark” isn’t a real test of how good a card is. That’s like comparing a server engine load to stability/lag

Right… so testing to see what frames per second it gets on certain games isn’t a test of performance?
Just read this, it compares all three cards in many different ways, noise, power consumption, selected games etc:
http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/geforce-gtx-670-review,3200-5.html (Bf3 benchmark, see other pages at bottom)

7970 comes out bottom, don’t go AMD.

Also, why the 800W PSU? You could run this build on 600W quite easily.

Read full topic

item.title: Gtx 670-680-amd 7970
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:10, topic:518744”][quote author=Stu link=topic=637008.msg4295047#msg4295047 date=1368064054]

I’ve been looking for cards and most people have recommended GTX 670 due to price and performance.

I max BF3 and get way over 80 FPS on a monitor 1920x1080.
